io.micronaut.http.server.netty

Class SmartHttpContentCompressor

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.channel.ChannelHandlerAdapter
      • io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandlerAdapter
        • io.netty.channel.ChannelDuplexHandler
          • io.netty.handler.codec.MessageToMessageCodec<io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpRequest,io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpObject>

              • io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpContentCompressor
                • io.micronaut.http.server.netty.SmartHttpContentCompressor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    io.netty.channel.ChannelHandler, io.netty.channel.ChannelInboundHandler, io.netty.channel.ChannelOutboundHandler

    public class SmartHttpContentCompressor
extends io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpContentCompressor
    An extension of HttpContentCompressor that skips encoding if the content type is not compressible or if the content is too small.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    James Kleeh

    • Method Detail

      • shouldSkip

        public static boolean shouldSkip(@Nullable
                                 String contentType,
                                 @Nullable
                                 Integer contentLength)
        Determines if encoding should occur based on the content type and length.
        Parameters:
        contentType - The content type
        contentLength - The content length
        Returns:
        True if the content is compressible and larger than 1KB

      • shouldSkip

        public static boolean shouldSkip(io.netty.handler.codec.http.HttpHeaders headers)
        Determines if encoding should occur based on the content type and length.
        Parameters:
        headers - The headers that contain the content type and length
        Returns:
        True if the content is compressible and larger than 1KB
